entry.title: Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin
entry.summary: In a recent discussion on the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, Agustin Cruz highlighted a critical distinction between the ETH/ETC split and a proposed change for Bitcoin in relation to post-quantum (PQ) migration strategies. Cruz pointed out that, unlike the Ethereum/Ethereum Classic split where no participants lost access except the individual(s) involved in the DAO hack, the proposed Bitcoin migration approach involves a scenario where certain holders might lose access to their coins. This differentiation underscores a unique challenge within the Bitcoin community's ongoing considerations for enhancing security against quantum computing threats. The conversation reflects the complexities involved in making systemic changes to blockchain protocols, especially when such changes may negatively impact a subset of users by confiscating their assets.
